content: The current thread for combinatorial game theory formalization #general > Combinatorial game theory repository (whose associated repository is https://github.com/vihdzp/combinatorial-games/) has picked up some activity recently, and it's getting harder to find information. Can we get a new combinatorial game theory channel in Zulip for this topic?
(I'd like to note that there's also a lot of activity locked behind my DMs with Tristan and Aaron)

The repo seems to be active and growing, so I don't see any reason why there shouldn't be a channel. Here's the questions you need to answer before someone can create it:

Screenshot from 2025-07-26 18-44-07.png
For the access question: web-public is the channels with the globe icon to the left of them in the channel list, public is the hashtag icon, and private is a lock icon.

What about

combinatorial-games
Discussion about the ongoing formalization of combinatorial game theory (CGT) in Lean 4
I don't see a problem with leaving it as web-public
